qas.question: What is often difficult on the island?
What type of activity did early settlers use to get food that didn't involve farming?
What is the name of the main commercial port in St. Barts?
What is grown in patches on the island?
What seasoning is found naturally on the island?
What was the first vegetable grown on the island by early settlers?
What's the most popular fruit at luxury hospitals and villas?

context: <a0_0>Agricultural production<a0_0/> on the island is difficult given the dry and rocky terrain, but the early settlers managed to produce vegetables, cotton, pineapples, <a4_0>salt<a4_0/>, <b8_0>bananas<b8_0/> and also <a1_0>fishing<a1_0/>. <a3_0><b7_0>Sweet potato<b7_0/><a3_0/> is also grown <b5_0><b6_0><b9_0>in patches<b9_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/>. The islanders developed commerce through the port of <a2_0>Gustavia<a2_0/>. Duty-free port attractions, retail trade, high-end tourism (mostly from North America) and its luxury hotels and villas have increased the island's prosperity, reflected in the high standard of living of its citizens.
